title: TROLL TEE
text:
Introduction
The general idea is to test the ability of TROLL 4.0 (Maréchaux et al. 2024; Schmitt et al. 2024) to simulate a Throughfall Exclusion Experiment (TEE) in Amazonia based on the Tapajos experiment (Nepstad et al. 2002) compared to previous model intercomparisons (Powell et al. 2013) to assess its ability to model the response of tropical moist forests (TMF) to climate change (Joetzjer et al. 2014). Note: Water stress may be underrepresented due to the potential for pre-dawn drought, and this may be an opportunity to improve its representation with explicit tree hydraulic resistance.

title: TROLL TEE
text:
Poeple

Sylvain Schmitt (sylvain.schmitt@cirad.fr)
Jérôme Chave (jerome.chave@univ-tlse3.fr)
Isabelle Maréchaux (isabelle.marechaux@inrae.fr)





Joetzjer, E., C. Delire, H. Douville, P. Ciais, B. Decharme, R. Fisher, B. Christoffersen, et al. 2014. “Predicting the Response of the Amazon Rainforest to Persistent Drought Conditions Under Current and Future Climates: A Major Challenge for Global Land Surface Models.” Geoscientific Model Development 7 (6): 2933–50. https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-7-2933-2014.


Maréchaux, Isabelle, Fabian Jörg Fischer, Sylvain Schmitt, and Jérôme Chave. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 1: Model Description.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3104.


Nepstad, D. C., P. Moutinho, M. B. Dias-Filho, E. Davidson, G. Cardinot, D. Markewitz, R. Figueiredo, et al. 2002. “The Effects of Partial Throughfall Exclusion on Canopy Processes, Aboveground Production, and Biogeochemistry of an Amazon Forest.” Journal of Geophysical Research: Atmospheres 107 (D20). https://doi.org/10.1029/2001jd000360.


Powell, Thomas L., David R. Galbraith, Bradley O. Christoffersen, Anna Harper, Hewlley M. A. Imbuzeiro, Lucy Rowland, Samuel Almeida, et al. 2013. “Confronting Model Predictions of Carbon Fluxes with Measurements of Amazon Forests Subjected to Experimental Drought.” New Phytologist 200 (2): 350–65. https://doi.org/10.1111/nph.12390.


Schmitt, Sylvain, Fabian Fischer, James Ball, Nicolas Barbier, Marion Boisseaux, Damien Bonal, Benoit Burban, et al. 2024. “TROLL 4.0: Representing Water and Carbon Fluxes, Leaf Phenology, and Intraspecific Trait Variation in a Mixed-Species Individual-Based Forest Dynamics Model  Part 2: Model Evaluation for Two Amazonian Sites.” http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-3106.

title: Data

title: Old
text:
Km67 Productivity
Cite: Costa, M.H. and W. Cohen. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-15 LAI and Productivity Data, km 67, Tapajos National Forest: 2003-2004. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1167


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_Dendrometer_measurements_2003_2004.csv", 
         skip = 24, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  gather(date, dendrometer,
         -plot, -subplot, -tree_no, -diameter, -comments) %>% 
  mutate(date = gsub("band_", "", date)) %>% 
  mutate(month = str_sub(date,1,2),
         year = str_sub(date,3,6)) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(paste0(year, "-", month, "-01"))) %>% 
  select(-year, -month) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, dendrometer, 
             group = paste(plot, subplot, tree_no))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Diameter (dendrometer) [ mm ]")





Dendrometer data available for fine temporal scale dynamics assessment.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_LAI_2004.csv",
         skip = 16, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(paste(year, month, day))) %>% 
  select(-year, -month, -day, -n) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, lai, col = as.character(plot))) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  xlab("") +
  ylab(expression("Leaf Area Index ["~m^2~m^{-2}~"]"))





LAI data available for seasonal variation of canopy leaf dynamics assessment.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_Litterfall_km67_2004.csv",
         skip = 10, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  rename(date = sample_date, litterfall = mass_litterfall) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, litterfall, col = paste(plot, subplot))) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  xlab("") +
  ylab(expression("Litterfall ["~g~0.25~m^{-2}~"|time lapse]"))





Litterfall data available for seasonal variation of canopy productivity dynamics assessment.

title: Old
text:
TEE Micrometeorology
Cite: Nepstad, D.C., P.R. Moutinho, and P. Brando. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-05 Soil VWC and Meteorology, Rainfall Exclusion, Tapajos National Forest. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1169


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD05_Micromet_1169/data/Rainfall_REE_plots_1999_2006.csv",
         skip = 12, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  gather(site, precipitation, -date, -exclusion) %>% 
  mutate(site = recode(site, 
                       "ppt_casa" = "Casa Onca (~1-km)",
                       "ppt_ree_tower" = "Control plot tower")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, precipitation, fill = exclusion == 1)) +
  geom_col() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ site, nrow = 2) +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Daily rainfall [mm]") +
  scale_fill_discrete("Exclusion") +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")





Precipitation data to force the model.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD05_Micromet_1169/data/Temp_RH_REE_plots_2000_2003.csv",
         skip = 16, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(datetime = as_datetime(paste(date, time))) %>% 
  select(-date, -time) %>% 
  gather(variable, value, -treatment, -sensor_code, -location, -height, -datetime) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(datetime, value, group = sensor_code, col = paste(treatment, location))) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~ paste(variable, height, "m"), nrow = 3, scales = "free_y") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_color_discrete("") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())





Possible evaluation data for microclimate buffering.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD05_Micromet_1169/data/VWC_REE_plots_1999_2007.csv",
         skip = 15, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_datetime(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, vwc_reprocessed, 
             group = paste(treatment, pit, side, depth), col = depth)) +
  geom_line() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_viridis_c(expression("Depth [ m ]")) +
  xlab("") + ylab(expression("Volumetric Water Content [ VWC"~cm^3~cm^{-3}~"]"))







Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD05_Micromet_1169/data/VWC_REE_plots_1999_2007.csv",
         skip = 15, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_datetime(date)) %>% 
  group_by(date, depth, treatment) %>% 
  summarise(vwc = mean(vwc_reprocessed, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, depth, col = vwc)) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_viridis_c(expression("Volumetric Water Content [ VWC"~cm^3~cm^{-3}~"]"),
                        direction = -1) +
  xlab("") + ylab(expression("Depth [ m ]")) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")





To evaluated soil water dynamics.

title: Old
text:
TEE soil water content
Cite: Belk, E.L., D. Markewitz, T. Rasmussen, E.J.M. Carvalho, D.C. Nepstad, and E.A. Davidson. 2012. LBA-ECO ND-02 Soil Volumetric Water Content, Tapajos National Forest, Brazil. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1061


Code
bind_rows(
  read_csv("data/raw_data/ND02_REE_Soil_VWC_1061/data/Seca_Floresta_actual_vs_simulated_VWC_control_plot.csv",
         skip = 36, na = "-9999"),
  read_csv("data/raw_data/ND02_REE_Soil_VWC_1061/data/Seca_Floresta_actual_vs_simulated_VWC_treatment_plot.csv",
         skip = 36, na = "-9999")) %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  select(date, plot_type, starts_with("a")) %>% 
  gather(depth, vwc, -date, -plot_type) %>% 
  mutate(depth = as.numeric(gsub("a", "", depth))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, vwc, col = depth, 
             group = paste(plot_type, depth))) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ plot_type, nrow = 2) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(expression("Depth [ m ]")) +
  xlab("") + ylab(expression("Volumetric Water Content [ VWC"~cm^3~cm^{-3}~"]"))





To evaluated soil water dynamics.

title: Old
text:
TEE biophysical
Cite: Nepstad, D.C. and P.R. Moutinho. 2013. LBA-ECO LC-14 Biophysical Measurements, Rainfall Exclusion, Tapajos National Forest. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1196


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Canopy_density_REE_plots_1998_2004.csv", skip = 11, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
   mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, cover, 
             group = paste(sampling_location, treatment))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment) +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Percent of closed canopy above the sampling point")





Measured with a spherical densitometer, not sure could be used with TROLL.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/LAI_REE_plots_1999_2006.csv",
         skip = 14, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
   mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, lai, 
             group = paste(treatment, grid))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  xlab("") +
  ylab(expression("Leaf Area Index ["~m^2~m^{-2}~"]"))





LAI data available for seasonal variation of canopy leaf dynamics assessment.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Dendrometer_DBH_REE_Plots_1999_2006.csv", 
         skip = 19, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  select(treatment, tree_id, life_form, family, genus_species, common_name,
         height_m, starts_with("dbh_"), date_death, field_notes) %>% 
  gather(date, dbh,
         -treatment, -tree_id, -life_form, -family, 
         -genus_species, -common_name,
         -height_m, -dbh_init,  -date_death, -field_notes) %>% 
  mutate(date = gsub("dbh_", "", date)) %>% 
  mutate(month = str_sub(date,1,3),
         year = str_sub(date,4,5)) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(year, "-", month, "-01")) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  select(-year, -month) %>% 
  filter(life_form == "tree") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, dbh, 
             col = genus_species,
             group = paste(treatment, tree_id))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("") +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment) +
  ylab("Diameter at breast height [ cm ]") +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  scale_y_log10()





Can be used to assess TEE on dynamics simulation in TROLL.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Stem_inventory_REE_plots_2000_2004.csv", skip = 15, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  filter(life_form == "TREE") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(dbh_2000, fill = obs_final)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  scale_y_log10() +
  ylab("") + xlab("DBH 2000 [ cm ]") +
  scale_fill_discrete("")





To assess treatment effect on mortality and growth (DBH 2004 available).


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Fine_Litter_REE_plots_1998_2006.csv", skip = 16, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  gather(type, mass, -treatment, -date, -point) %>% 
  mutate(type = gsub("mass_", "", type)) %>% 
  mutate(type = gsub("_", " ", type)) %>% 
  na.omit() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, mass, col = type, 
             group = paste(treatment, point, type))) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.2) +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_y_log10() +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Mass ["~g~m^{-2}~d^{-1}~"]")





Great data to assess TEE effect on fine litterfall.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Coarse_litter_REE_plots_1998_2006.csv", skip = 12, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
    mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, mass_coarse_litter)) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.2) +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_y_log10() +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Mass coarse litter ["~g~m^{-2}~d^{-1}~"]")





Not sure can be used in TROLL evaluation.

title: Forest
text:
Undisturbed

LBA-ECO CD-15 LAI and Productivity Data, km 67, Tapajos National Forest
Cite: Costa, M.H. and W. Cohen. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-15 LAI and Productivity Data, km 67, Tapajos National Forest: 2003-2004. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1167


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_Dendrometer_measurements_2003_2004.csv", 
         skip = 24, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  gather(date, dendrometer,
         -plot, -subplot, -tree_no, -diameter, -comments) %>% 
  mutate(date = gsub("band_", "", date)) %>% 
  mutate(month = str_sub(date,1,2),
         year = str_sub(date,3,6)) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(paste0(year, "-", month, "-01"))) %>% 
  select(-year, -month) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, dendrometer, 
             group = paste(plot, subplot, tree_no))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("") +
  ylab("Diameter (dendrometer) [ mm ]")





Dendrometer data available for fine temporal scale dynamics assessment.

title: Forest
text:
TEE

LBA-ECO LC-14 Biophysical Measurements, Rainfall Exclusion, Tapajos National Forest
Cite: Nepstad, D.C. and P.R. Moutinho. 2013. LBA-ECO LC-14 Biophysical Measurements, Rainfall Exclusion, Tapajos National Forest. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1196


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Dendrometer_DBH_REE_Plots_1999_2006.csv", 
         skip = 19, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  select(treatment, tree_id, life_form, family, genus_species, common_name,
         height_m, starts_with("dbh_"), date_death, field_notes) %>% 
  gather(date, dbh,
         -treatment, -tree_id, -life_form, -family, 
         -genus_species, -common_name,
         -height_m, -dbh_init,  -date_death, -field_notes) %>% 
  mutate(date = gsub("dbh_", "", date)) %>% 
  mutate(month = str_sub(date,1,3),
         year = str_sub(date,4,5)) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(year, "-", month, "-01")) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  select(-year, -month) %>% 
  filter(life_form == "tree") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, dbh, 
             col = genus_species,
             group = paste(treatment, tree_id))) +
  geom_line(alpha = .2) +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("") +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment) +
  ylab("Diameter at breast height [ cm ]") +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  scale_y_log10()





Can be used to assess TEE on dynamics simulation in TROLL.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/LC14_Aboveground_Prod_1196/data/Stem_inventory_REE_plots_2000_2004.csv", skip = 15, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  filter(life_form == "TREE") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(dbh_2000, fill = obs_final)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~ treatment, nrow = 2) +
  scale_x_log10() +
  scale_y_log10() +
  ylab("") + xlab("DBH 2000 [ cm ]") +
  scale_fill_discrete("")





To assess treatment effect on mortality and growth (DBH 2004 available).

title: Fluxes
text:
Undisturbed

LBA-ECO CD-15 LAI and Productivity Data, km 67, Tapajos National Forest
Cite: Costa, M.H. and W. Cohen. 2013. LBA-ECO CD-15 LAI and Productivity Data, km 67, Tapajos National Forest: 2003-2004. Data set. Available on-line [http://daac.ornl.gov] from Oak Ridge National Laboratory Distributed Active Archive Center, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, U.S.A. http://dx.doi.org/10.3334/ORNLDAAC/1167


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_LAI_2004.csv",
         skip = 16, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(paste(year, month, day))) %>% 
  select(-year, -month, -day, -n) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, lai, col = as.character(plot))) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  xlab("") +
  ylab(expression("Leaf Area Index ["~m^2~m^{-2}~"]"))





LAI data available for seasonal variation of canopy leaf dynamics assessment.


Code
read_csv("data/raw_data/CD15_Productivity_1167/data/CD15_Litterfall_km67_2004.csv",
         skip = 10, na = "-9999") %>% 
  rename_all(tolower) %>% 
  rename(date = sample_date, litterfall = mass_litterfall) %>% 
  mutate(date = paste0(str_sub(date, 1,4), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 5,6), "-",
                       str_sub(date, 7,8))) %>% 
  mutate(date = as_date(date)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(date, litterfall, col = paste(plot, subplot))) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  scale_color_discrete(guide = "none") +
  xlab("") +
  ylab(expression("Litterfall ["~g~0.25~m^{-2}~"|time lapse]"))





Litterfall data available for seasonal variation of canopy productivity dynamics assessment.
